notes.note:
[Firefox for Android][1] can now be set as the default PDF reader.


  [1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.mozilla.fenix

Starting with Firefox 122, the URL Paste Suggestion feature is now enabled by default in Nightly builds. This enhancement provides a convenient way for users to quickly visit URLs copied to the clipboard in the address bar of desktop Firefox. When the clipboard contains a URL, and the user focuses on the URL bar, an autocomplete result appears automatically. Activating the clipboard suggestion will navigate the user to the URL with 1 click.

Starting with Firefox 122, scroll animations triggered using a mouse wheel or using the keyboard (e.g. arrow keys, Page Down/Up) are now based on a Mass-Spring-Damper physics model in Nightly builds, this gives animations a more realistic feel.
Firefox now displays images and descriptions for search suggestions when provided by the search engine.
Starting with Firefox 122, it is now possible to highlight information in the Firefox PDF viewer in Nightly builds.

[Firefox for Android][1] now supports enabling [Global Privacy Control][2]. With this feature, Firefox informs the websites that the user doesn’t want their data to be shared or sold. This feature is enabled in private browsing mode by default and can be enabled in normal browsing in Settings → Enhanced Tracking Protection -> Tell websites not to share & sell data toggle.

[1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.mozilla.fenix
[2]: https://globalprivacycontrol.org/

Firefox now supports creating and using [passkeys][1] stored in the iCloud Keychain on macOS.

[1]: https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/create-a-passkey-mchl4af65d1a/mac

The line breaking rules of Web content now match the Unicode Standard. This improves Web Browser compatibility for line breaking.

An additional improvement for East Asian and South East Asian end users, Firefox now supports proper language-aware word selection when double-clicking on text, for languages including Chinese, Japanese, Burmese, Lao, Khmer, and Thai.

The [translations][1] feature received an improvement to the quality of translated webpages. The results should be much more stable. This fixes issues where the content of a page could disappear when translated, or interactive widgets could break.

[1]: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/website-translation
Starting with Firefox 120, ULPFE/RED is now on by default for video in Nightly builds. This provides additional protection against packet loss for video during WebRTC calls.

Firefox now supports animating the SVG  [viewBox][1] attribute using [SMIL][2] `by animations`. `by animations` are animations that are relative to the original value. Other attributes such as lengths and angles already support `by`, but a `viewBox` consists of four separate values.

[1]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/viewBox
[2]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/SVG_animation_with_SMIL

The [LargestContentfulPaint API][1] has been added, this provides timing information about the largest image or text paint before users interact with a web page.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/LargestContentfulPaint
`<hr>-in-<select>` is now supported, allowing websites to easily use separators inside a `<select>` element.

Starting with Firefox 122,  the `popover` attribute is now supported by default in Nightly builds. The [popover][1] global attribute is used to designate an element as a popover element. The element won't render until it becomes shown, it will then render on top of other page content.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/popover

The [showPicker][1] method is now supported on `<select>` elements, this can be used to trigger the drop-down behavior via JavaScript.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLSelectElement/showPicker
The fallback URL parser for unknown schemes was changed to `DefaultURI` this improves specification adherence and web compatibility.

Added support for [ray()][1] to the [offset-path][2] CSS property.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/ray
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Enabled the [offset-position][1] property which is useful for most of the [offset-path][2] values.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Added support for [basic-shape][1] and [coord-box][2] for the [offset-path][3] CSS property.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/box-edge#values
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Starting with Firefox 122,  the remaining part of the [async clipboard API][1] has been enabled by default in Nightly builds. A paste context menu will appear for the user to confirm when attempting to read clipboard data not provided by the [same-origin][2] page.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Clipboard_API
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/Security/Same-origin_policy

Enabled the [ArrayBuffer.prototype.transfer proposal][1] methods, which enables transferring ownership of [ArrayBuffer][2] data.

[1]: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-arraybuffer-transfer
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/ArrayBuffer

Added support for [rect()][1] and [xywh()][2] basic shapes on [clip-path][3] and [offset-path][4] CSS properties.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Element/rect
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape/xywh
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/clip-path
[4]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path

Starting with Firefox 122, support for the [Screen Wake Lock API][1] is available in Nightly builds. 

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Screen_Wake_Lock_API

Starting with Firefox 122, Nightly builds include support for Unicode text [segmentation][1] to JavaScript.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Segmenter

Firefox now recognizes the ["webauthn" autocomplete token][1] and will suggest [passkeys in form autofill dialogs][2].

[1]: https://github.com/w3c/webauthn/wiki/Explainer:-WebAuthn-Conditional-UI
[2]: https://web.dev/articles/passkey-form-autofill

Scripts can now store cacheAPI data in Private Browsing mode. Previously, user experience for someone browsing in private browsing mode could be significantly different than in regular mode. With these changes, websites can store cacheAPI data in Private Mode moving towards a uniform experience in regular vs Private Browsing mode.

To further protect user privacy Firefox now [taints][1] filters that use currentColor as an input. Since color can be set by the [:visited][2] pseudo selector, it potentially contains privacy-sensitive information and therefore these primitives must be marked as tainted. This means that if you use such a filter you won't be able to read the filter output from canvas.


  [1]: https://www.w3.org/TR/filter-effects-1/#tainted-filter-primitives
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/:visited
Some machines with older AMD CPUs may see image thumbnails incorrectly render as all black in file dialogs. If this is the case, updating the graphics driver should address this issue.

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio

Firefox Nightly gets updated every day and as a consequence, the release notes for the Nightly channel are updated continuously to reflect features that have reached sufficient maturity to benefit from community feedback and bug reports. 

**Warning: Features listed here may or may *not* make a final release of Firefox.**

In addition to these release notes, you can follow ongoing development on our [@FirefoxNightly][1] Twitter account, our  [@FirefoxNightly@mozilla.social][4] Mastodon account as well as read our [Nightly Blog][2].

You can interact with other Firefox Nightly users and give your feedback to Mozilla staff in the [Nightly Matrix room][3] on chat.mozilla.org.


  [1]: https://twitter.com/FirefoxNightly
  [2]: https://blog.nightly.mozilla.org
  [3]: https://chat.mozilla.org/?#/room/#nightly:mozilla.org
  [4]: https://mozilla.social/@FirefoxNightly
